result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Ignition Interlock Device Tampering/Failure to Install/Violate Court Order
Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Zachary James Miller

records.addlTxt: DE left VM stating he wasn't sure if he had court or not and wondered if he needed to provide proof of DL to someone.  Clerk advised he'd need to provide that proof to the DA's office.  DE states he did talk to someone yesterday about that and received a fax number for the DA's office.  DE plans to fax that DL proof today. bph

8:48 AM CO: SJN, RPR: V. Deiss, Clerk: K. Anderson, Attorney Brian Thomas Smestad in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Zachary James Miller in court. Court reviews case. DE previously waived right to counsel. ADA Smestad states that DE is going to obtain license very shortly. Court sets 30-day internal review for stipulation. Adjourned: 8:51 AM. kma
Review scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 07:45 am.

8:30 AM CO: SJN, RPR: V. Deiss, Clerk: K. Anderson, Attorney Michael Joseph Becker in court for State of Wisconsin, Defendant Zachary James Miller in court. Court notes DE previously waived right to counsel. ADA Becker states that DE is completing some things to move towards resolution, requests additional hearing in a couple weeks to get DE updated offer. Court sets STC, possible plea. Adjourned:
Status conference scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 08:45 am.
Status conference on August 29, 2022 at 08:45 am.
from DE to appear by Zoom for 8/18 PSC.  Denied. JA p/c to DE re same. kp/gll
DE called asking if he could appear by Zoom for tomorrow's hearing. Clerk advised he would need to write a letter and provided fax #.  gll

08:45 AM  CO: SJN, RPR: V. Deiss, Clerk: K. Anderson, ADA:  Brian Thomas Smestad, DE: Zachary James Miller pro se. Court reviews file. DE wishes to represent himself. DE sworn.Court questions DE. Ct finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives counsel and is competent to represent himself. Court notes previously scheduled hearings. Adjourned: 8:49 AM. kma
Status conference on June 24, 2022 at 08:45 am.

11:04 AM  CO: SJN, RPR: V. Deiss, Clerk: K. Anderson, ADA:  Brian Thomas Smestad, DE: Zachary James Miller appeared by video means. DE wishes to represent himself. Court sets STC for possible in-person waiver of counsel. Adjourned: 11:07 AM. kma  Status conference scheduled for June 24, 2022 at 08:45 am.
Misdemeanor and Criminal Traffic Scheduling Order. Signed by SJN on 6/21/2022. c: DA and Atty via e-file. km

Status conference on June 22, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Settlement conference on July 13, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Pre-trial/scheduling conference on August 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license or Ignition Interlock Device.

01:34 PM CO: SJN, RPR: V. Deiss, Clerk: S. Fox, ADA:   Brian Thomas Smestad w/Intern A. casey, DF ATTY:  Abrianna Dolfi for today,  DF:  Zachary James Miller appeared from jail.  Def does not qualify for a PD and intends to retain private counsel. On a probation hold.   Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG.   Status conference scheduled for June 22, 2022 at 10:30 am.  Settlement conference scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 02:00 pm.  Pre-trial/scheduling conference scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
